item.title: Ah... This is weird!
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

Wea, it says model successfully added… But when i weild it’ still a null!!! ARG!!!

Also when i drop it’s a peace of grass!? WTF!?

Please help! Maybe i cud pm you the client/server and you can see what ive done wrong?

Read full topic

item.title: Ah... This is weird!
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:3, topic:280159”][quote author=johno2 link=topic=369742.msg2797663#msg2797663 date=1243174894]
Ive added the model to my models folder on client (.dat file, that write kind?)
[/quote]

You need to put the .dat file into a gzip archive using gzip.

Now in your client use this following command:

::addmodel 7810 [/quote]
I did all you said, but it;s just a lump of grass when i drop it? Also, when i do the command

::addmodel 7810

Nothing comes up in chat bar? Surly something like

Model Added

Should come up? Help!

Also, if the model folder the model is called 306b, should i rename it to 7810?

Read full topic

item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

item = 7810	Starter_armour	Your_Starter_armour	20000	200000	20000	10	10	10	0	0	320	320	320	23	355	40	19

This is whats in my item.java

public static int body[] = {10300,11154,11471,10625,10628,10930,10933,10935,10937,10939,10941,10927,11998,11997,11281,10222,11268,10408,11977,11975,11198,11199,11200,11173,11175,11177,11179,11181,11183,11185,11187,11171,11169,11162,11158,11143,11138,11134,5032,5028,6065,1844,5034,6788,7134,7128,7110,7122,6750,6615,6617,5575,7592,6129,6322,6139,6133,129,6916,6654,7390,7392,7362,7364,7399,7374,7376,7372,7370,1035,540,5553,4757,1833,6388,6384,2501,2499,4111,4101,4091,6186,6184,6180,3058,4509,4504,4069,4728,4736,4712,6107,2661,3140,1101,1103,1105,1107,1109,1111,1113,1115,1117,1119,1121,1123,1125,1127,1129,1131,1133,1135,2499,2503,2583,2591,2599,2607,2615,2623,2653,2669,3481,4712,4720,4728,4749,4892,4893,4894,4895,4916,4917,4918,4919,4964,4965,4966,4967,6107,6133,6322,426,7633,7642,7661,7660,7667,7669,7684,7689,7698,3387,7695,544,546,7810};

As you can see, 7810 is at end

Ive added the model to my models folder on client (.dat file, that write kind?)

This is whats in class8.java

} if(i == 7810) { //Starter armour class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anIntArray156 = new int[9]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[9]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 10266; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 925; class8.anIntArray156[1] = 10275; class8.anIntArray160[1] = 925; class8.anIntArray156[2] = 10291; class8.anIntArray160[2] = 924; class8.anIntArray156[3] = 10283; class8.anIntArray160[3] = 924; class8.anIntArray156[4] = 4550; class8.anIntArray160[4] = 925; class8.anIntArray156[5] = 10287; class8.anIntArray160[5] = 924; class8.anIntArray156[6] = 8375; class8.anIntArray160[6] = 80; class8.anIntArray156[7] = 8384; class8.anIntArray160[7] = 75; class8.anIntArray156[8] = 8367; class8.anIntArray160[8] = 70; class8.anInt174 = 7810; //Model ID // 20233 class8.anInt181 = 1330; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 572; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 302; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = 0; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt165 = 14079;//male wearing // class8.anInt200 = 14079;//female wearing // class8.anInt164 = 14080;//Female arms/sleeves // class8.anInt188 = 14080;//male arms/sleeves // class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Starter Armour";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "Starter Armour. Made by tweezy".getBytes();//examin info

When i weild it, it’s in write place but it looks like a wall… The picture is blank… And it’s just a load a wood what is bigger then me… Heres a screen shot

Please help!
